metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5017 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: Buffer overflow in the C cli shell in Apache Zookeeper before 3.4.9 and 3.5.x before 3.5.3, when using the "cmd:" batch mode syntax, allows attackers to have unspecified impact via a long command string. It was discovered that Apache ZooKeeper incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause unspecified impact.

criterions.comment: zookeeper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
